item.title: Engaku-ji (円覚寺)
item.description:
M_Strasser posted a photo:

Zuirokuzan Engaku Kōshō Zenji (瑞鹿山円覚興聖禅寺), or Engaku-ji (円覚寺), is one of the most important Zen Buddhist temple complexes in Japan and is ranked second among Kamakura's Five Mountains. It is situated in the city of Kamakura, in Kanagawa prefecture to the south of Tokyo. It is very close to Kita-Kamakura Station on the Yokosuka Line, and indeed the railway tracks cut across the formal entrance to the temple compound, which (showing Chinese influence) is by a path beside a pond which is crossed by a small bridge. (Wikipedia)
item.author: nobody@flickr.com (M_Strasser)
item.media:title: Engaku-ji (円覚寺)
item.media:description: Zuirokuzan Engaku Kōshō Zenji (瑞鹿山円覚興聖禅寺), or Engaku-ji (円覚寺), is one of the most important Zen Buddhist temple complexes in Japan and is ranked second among Kamakura's Five Mountains. It is situated in the city of Kamakura, in Kanagawa prefecture to the south of Tokyo. It is very close to Kita-Kamakura Station on the Yokosuka Line, and indeed the railway tracks cut across the formal entrance to the temple compound, which (showing Chinese influence) is by a path beside a pond which is crossed by a small bridge. (Wikipedia)

item.title: Shizuka Gozen - Traditional Japanese Dancer
item.description:
Ronin Dave posted a photo:

Shizuka Gozen was an 12th Century shirabyoshi dancer who was forced to dance in Kamakura before the enemy of her love, Minamoto no Yoshitsune.
www.youtube.com/watch?v=t3aOABNeCEo
item.author: nobody@flickr.com (Ronin Dave)
item.media:title: Shizuka Gozen - Traditional Japanese Dancer
item.media:description:
